alert.note: Alert for Union (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 8:26PM EDT until May 14 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Central Indiana and Southeast Indiana, including the following counties, in East Central Indiana, Fayette IN and Union IN. In Southeast Indiana, Franklin IN. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 825 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain fell due to thunderstorms. Flooding is likely occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Connersville, Brookville, Blooming Grove, Columbia, Metamora, Bunker Hill, Laurel, Cedar Grove, Everton, Alpine, Mounds State Recreation Area, Nulltown, Alquina and Springersville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
